document_data.name: Far Forest
document_data.mainbody: The '''Far Forest''' was one of a group of three forests named the [[Triangle of Trees]].
document_data.Description:
The Far Forest was full of small lakes, some of which had become stinking marshes infested by [[will-o'-wisp]]s and a few [[chuul]].

These woods had a handful of sites where ancient ruins were covered by roots and climbing plants.
document_data.History:
This was once a relatively peaceful forest much like the brighter parts of the nearby [[High Forest]], but as dark creatures poured out of [[Hellgate Keep]] into these woods, the [[dryad]]s and [[treant]]s of the forest left. Over time, the forest itself became dark and twisted by the demonic forces from Hellgate Keep.  Before the fall of Hellgate Keep there were no sylvan races left in these woods. With the fall of Hellgate Keep treants and dryads moved back in and the fiendish creatures have fled the forest, some traveling south towards the [[Fallen Lands]].

Around the {{YearlinkName|1370}}, the forest was tended by [[Turlang]] and his forest followers.

Around the {{YearlinkName|1372}}, [[centaur]]s and [[satyr]]s moved to explore the southern area while some deadly plants and trees like [[tendriculos]]es and [[assassin vine]]s were placed by Turlang along the western slope of the forest to discourage deforestation.
document_data.Inhabitants:
The heart of the forest was populated by [[giant spider]]s and other creatures that were the result of cruel magical experiments conducted by the [[Netherese]]. Travelers who journeyed through the Forest faced many dangers: [[ettercap]], [[bear]]s, [[owlbear]]s, [[spider]]s, giant [[beetle]]s, [[snake]]s and [[stirge]]s roamed among the trees. The eastern side of the forest was less dense than the rest of the forest.

A number of [[fey]] creatures dwelled within the forest, namely dryads and [[Sprite (creature)|sprites]].
